analyzed: jatā jagā go tu sametha pāde
translated: Ja, tā, ja, ga, go, if it is even, then on the foot. (upendavajira)

original: Ja,tā ja,gā go visame same tu; (Upendavajira)
analyzed: jatāḥ jagāḥ go visame same tu
translated: Ja, tā, ja, ga, go, if it is uneven, if it is even; (Upendavajira)

analyzed: tā jaḥ gagā ce viparīta pubbā
translated: Tā jo, ga, ga, ce, if it is reversed from the previous. (indavajira)

analyzed: sa sataḥ sa lagāḥ visame same
translated: Sa, sa, to, sa, la, ga, if it is uneven, if it is even;
Na, bha, bha, rā, it becomes the deer-leap.

analyzed: yadi na na ra la gā na jā jarā
translated: If it is na, na, ra, la, ga, na, ja, ja, rā,
And if then it desires the opposite turn.
If it has gone to the uneven, na, nā, ra, yā ce;

analyzed: na c aja ra gā samake ca pupphi taggā
translated: Na,ja,ja,ra,gā samake ca pupphitaggā.
This pair is the Vetālīya kind.

original: Sā yavādikā matī ra,jā ra,jā tva,
analyzed: sā yava ādikā matiḥ rajā rajā tva
translated: That is the Yavādika metre: ra,jā ra,jā tva,

original: Same same ja,rā ja,rā garū bhaveyyuṃ.
analyzed: same same jarā jarā garū bhaveyyum
translated: Same same ja,rā ja,rā garū bhaveyyuṃ.

analyzed: iti vutta udaye chandasi aḍḍhasamavuttiniddesaḥ nāma
translated: Thus is concluded the explanation of the half-line order in the chandas in the order of arising.
The fourth chapter.
The fifth chapter, the explanation of the irregular order
In the feet with eight syllables, the order of the syllables is from snā’dimhā yo’ṇṇavā.

original: 119. Samesu sindhuto jena, pathyāvattaṃ pakittitaṃ.🔽120. Ojesu jena sindhuto, ta’meva vīparītā’di.
analyzed: samesu sindhutaḥ jena pathyāvattam pakittitam  ojesu jena sindhutaḥ tam eva
translated: In the equal ones, from sindhu to jena, the pathyā order is proclaimed.🔽In the odd ones, from jena to sindhu, that very order is reversed, etc.

original: 121. Na,kāro ce jaladhito, capalāvatta’micce’taṃ.🔽122. Same lo sattamo yassā, vipulā piṅgalassa sā.
analyzed: nakāraḥ ce jaladhitaḥ  same sattamaḥ yassā vipulā piṅgalassa sā
translated: If the syllable na is from jaladhi, that is the capalā order.
In the equal ones, the seventh of which is lo, that is the vipulā of Setavassā’khilesupi.
Bhena’ṇṇavā bha’bbipulā.
Eva’maññā ro catutthā.

analyzed: na u ṇ navā ce na vipulā
translated: No’ṇṇavā ce navipulā.
To’ṇṇavā tathā’ññā siyā.
The order of the syllables.

original: Nadissate’ttha yaṃ chandaṃ, payoge dissate yadi;
translated: If the chandas is not seen here, but is seen in the application,
That is a verse with uneven feet, and it is called a Sāmaññā verse.

original: Iti vuttodaye chandasi visamavutti niddeso nāma
analyzed: iti vutta udaye chandasi visama vutti niddesaḥ nāma
translated: Thus the explanation of uneven usage in the Chandovatta is finished.
The fifth chapter.
The sixth chapter on the analysis of the six conditions🔽The method of adding

original: Patthāre sabbage pāde, pubbagā’dho lpa’re samā;
analyzed: patthāre sabbage pāde pubbaga adhas l pare samā
translated: In adding, the first foot is the base, below the first syllable is the remainder, and the same;

original: Pubbe garu te ca mime, kattabbā yāva sabbalā.
analyzed: pubbe garu te ca mime kattabbā yāva sabbalā
translated: First, heavy, and those two light, should be done up to the end.
The method of subtraction

original: Naṭṭhassa yo bhaveyya’ṅko, tasmiṃ lo’ddhikate same;
analyzed: naṭṭhassa yaḥ bhaveyya aṅkaḥ tasmin la uddhi kate same
translated: If there were a part that is subtracted, in that, the addition is the same;
But in the uneven, if it cannot be done, the addition should be heavy.
The method of reciting

analyzed: eka ādi nuk kamena aṅke pubba adhas dviguṇe likhe
translated: In the part beginning with one, write the first below the first, doubled;
With the light ones mixed in, it becomes the recited one, and so on.
The method of doing everything with the base🔽The number is the same as the syllables stated, written one above the other;

analyzed: eka eka hīnam eka ādi sabbaga ādikam
translated: Each one less, beginning with one, in the place of the subtracted, beginning with all.
The method of counting the stated number

analyzed: garukriyā aṅka sandohe bhave saṅkhyā vimissite
translated: In the combination of the heavy part and the part, if the number is mixed up,
The collection of the recited parts, that is the same in this same method.
The measure of a yojana

analyzed: saṅkhyā iva dviguṇā īkūnā vitthārā āyāma sambhavā
translated: The yojana is double the number of the digits, and is the extent of the sky’s circumference;
The measure of a finger is the weight of a grain of sesame.

analyzed: iti vutta udaye chandasi chappaccayavibhāgaḥ nāma
translated: Thus ends the analysis of the six factors in the Chandas of the Vuttodaya.
The sixth chapter.
Conclusion🔽The Elder Sīlā, who dwelt in the Āyatana Vihāra,

analyzed: pādaḥ garu gguṇa garu jayatam mama isaḥ
translated: May this foot, which is heavy with the weight of virtue, be victorious!

original: Yassa ppabhāva’mavalamba maye’disopi,🔽Sampādito’bhimata siddhikaro parattho.🔽Parattha sampādanato, puññenā’dhigatena’haṃ;
analyzed: yassa ppa bhāvam avalamba mayā idisā upi  sampādita ubhimata siddhi karaḥ parattho  parattha sampādanato puññena adhigatena aham
translated: By the power of which, even I, have been able to accomplish🔽The highest good, which brings about the desired success.🔽By the merit I have gained by accomplishing the highest good,
May I be one who accomplishes the highest good in life after life.
Just as the six factors have been accomplished by me🔽Through the mere sight of the Vuttodaya, may they be accomplished

original: Sādhitā sādhayante’va, micchitatthampi pāṇinoti.🔽Iti saṅgharakkhitamahāsāmittherena viracitaṃ
analyzed: sādhitā sādhayantā iva  iti saṅgharakkhita mahā sāmi therena viracitam
translated: Even for those who have gone astray.🔽Thus ends the Vuttodaya treatise
Composed by the Elder Saṅgharakkhita Mahāsāmi.
